questions.question: 1. What is the first step in the isolation of lymphocytes from peripheral blood?

answers.a: Layer the blood sample onto a density gradient medium
answers.b: Dilute collected blood with equal volume of PBS buffer
answers.c: Add an anticoagulant to the blood sample
answers.d: Centrifuge the blood sample at high speeds

questions.question: 2. What is the function of washing the isolated lymphocytes before staining with Leishman stain?

answers.a: To remove residual Ficoll Hypaque solution and Platelets
answers.b: To lyse the red blood cells
answers.c: To prevent the lymphocytes from adhering to the slide
answers.d: To enhance the staining of the lymphocytes

questions.question: 3. What is the principle of Leishman staining?

answers.a: It stains the cytoplasm of the cells
answers.b: It stains the nuclei of the cells
answers.c: It stains the cell membranes of the cells
answers.d: It stains the mitochondria of the cells

questions.question: 4. Which cell culture media is used to culture lymphocytes?
5. How do lymphocytes appear upon Leishman staining?

answers.a: Pale pink cytoplasm with dark blue nuclei and orange-red granules
answers.c: Blue cytoplasm with dark purple nuclei
answers.d: Purple cytoplasm with dark blue nuclei

questions.question: 6. What is the purpose of using EDTA when collecting whole blood for lymphocyte isolation?

answers.a: To lyse the red blood cells

questions.question: 7. What is the 'Buffy coat' layer primarily composed of after centrifugation?
8. What is the role of memory B or T cells?

answers.a: To initiate an immediate immune response upon re-exposure to the same antigen
answers.b: To present antigens to naive B and T cells

questions.question: 9. Which of the following is true about B-cell receptors (BCR)?

answers.a: They have a single antigen-binding region.
answers.b: They are composed of Igα/Igβ heterodimers and membrane immunoglobulin.
answers.c: They recognize antigens processed by MHC.
answers.d: They do not undergo clonal expansion.

questions.question: 10. Why is it important to avoid mixing the diluted blood with Ficoll-Hypaque during the layering step?

answers.b: To maintain the density gradient for effective cell separation
